font-size: 22px;    }}@media (max-width: 650px){    .right-panel, .left-panel {        border: 0px;        padding-right: 0px;        padding-left: 0px;        margin-bottom: 0px;    }    .small {        width: 100%;        margin-top: 0px;    }}</style><p>The 2017 Summer Movie Preview is a snapshot of the films opening through early September. Release dates and other details are subject to change.</p><p class=\"date-title\">April 28 </p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Below Her Mouth</h3><p>A fashion editor finds herself drawn into a steamy affair with another woman. With Natalie Krill, Sebastian Pigott, Erika Linder. Written by Stephanie Fabrizi. Directed by April Mullen. <em>Gunpowder &amp; Sky</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The Black Room</h3><p>A couple discover an evil, lustful presence inhabiting the basement of their new home. With Natasha Henstridge, Luke Hassel, Lin Shaye, Dominique Swain. Written and directed by Rolfe Kanefsky. <em>Cleopatra Entertainment</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Black Rose</h3><p>The LAPD recruits a Russian police officer to help hunt a serial killer. With Alexander Nevsky, Kristanna Loken, Adrian Paul, Robert Davi, Matthias Hues. Written by Brent Huff, George Saunders. Directed by Nevsky. <em>ITN Distribution</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Casting JonBen&eacute;t</h3><p>Meta-documentary by Kitty Green on the 1996 killing of 6-year-old JonBen&eacute;t Ramsey. <em>Netflix</em></p><p class=\"roadblock\"><strong><a href=\"http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-summer-movie-preview-2017-updates-htmlstory.html\">SEE OUR COMPLETE SUMMER MOVIE PREVIEW &raquo;</a></strong></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The Circle</h3><p>A young woman experiences success at the world&#39;s largest technology and social media company and is encouraged to live her life completely in the open. With Emma Watson, Tom Hanks, John Boyega, Patton Oswalt, Bill Paxton, Karen Gillan, Ellar Coltrane. Written and directed by James Ponsoldt, based on the novel by Dave Eggers. <em>STX Entertainment</em></p><figure class='full left'><div class='responsive-embed raw-brightcove'>92137734</div><figcaption>Emma Watson and Tom Hanks star in &quot;The Circle.&quot;</figcaption></figure><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Citizen Jane: Battle for the City</h3><p>Documentary explores the mid-20th-century battles between urbanization critic and activist Jane Jacobs and New York master builder Robert Moses. Directed by Matt Tyrnauer. <em>Sundance Selects</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Danger Close</h3><p>Female war correspondent Alex Quade chronicles the stories of U.S. Special Operations Forces in the third film in the &quot;Heroes of Valor&quot; docu-action series. Featuring Wendy R. Anderson. Written by Eli Baldridge and Quade. Directed by Christian Tureaud and David Salzberg. <em>Gravitas Ventures</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">A Dark Song</h3><p>In a cabin in northern Wales, two lost souls experiment with black magic. With Steve Oram, Catherine Walker. Written and directed by Liam Gavin. <em>IFC Midnight</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Displacement</h3><p>A physics student time travels as she attempts to solve her boyfriend&#39;s murder. With Courtney Hope, Bruce Davison, Susan Blakely, Sarah Douglas, Lou Richards, Karan Oberoi, Christopher Backus. Written and directed by Kenneth Mader. <em>Arcadia Releasing Group</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Grey Lady</h3><p>A Boston homicide detective hunts his partner&#39;s killer on Nantucket Island. With Eric Dane, Natalie Zea, Adrian Lester, Carolyn Stotesbery, Chris Meyer, Rebecca Gayheart. Written and directed by John Shea. <em>Beacon Pictures / Broadvision Entertainment</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">How to Be a Latin Lover</h3><p>Eugenio Derbez stars as a struggling middle-aged gigolo forced to move in with his sister and nephew. With Salma Hayek, Rob Lowe, Kristen Bell, Raquel Welch, Rob Corddry, Rob Riggle, Michael Cera, Raphael Alejandro. Written by Chris Spain, Jon Zack. Directed by Ken Marino. <em>Pantelion</em></p><figure class='full left'><div class='responsive-embed raw-brightcove'>92595644</div><figcaption>Eugenio Derbez, Salma Hayek and Rob Lowe star in &quot;How to Be a Latin Lover.&quot;</figcaption></figure><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The King&#39;s Case Note</h3><p>During Korea&rsquo;s Joseon Dynasty, King Yejong and his assistant investigate rumors that there will be an attempt on the throne. With Lee Sun-kyun, Ahn Jae-hong. Written by Kang Hyun-sung. Directed by Moon Hyung-sung. <em>CJ Entertainment</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">LA92</h3><p>The Los Angeles uprising after the Rodney King verdict is explored through archival footage in this documentary marking the 25th anniversary. Directed by Daniel Lindsay, T.J. Martin. <em>National Geographic</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">One Week and a Day</h3><p>At the end of the traditional Jewish mourning period after the death of his son, a middle-aged Israeli man chooses to see what makes life meaningful rather than return to his regular routine. With Shai Avivi, Evgenia Dodina, Tomer Kapon. Written and directed by Asaph Polonsky. <em>Oscilloscope Laboratories</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Rupture</h3><p>A single mom is abducted and learns she has a genetic abnormality that could cause her true alien nature to be revealed. With Noomi Rapace, Michael Chiklis, Peter Stormare, Kerry Bishe. Written by Steven Shainberg and Brian Nelson. Directed by Shainberg. <em>AMBI Media Group</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Slack Bay</h3><p>An eccentric family spend its summer in a coastal villa in early 20th century France. With Juliette Binoche, Fabrice Luchini, Valeria Bruni Tedeschi. Written and directed by Bruno Dumont. <em>Kino Lorber</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Sleight</h3><p>A young street magician must use his mystical ways to rescue his kidnapped sister. With Jacob Latimore, Storm Reid, Seychelle Gabriel, Dul&eacute; Hill, Sasheer Zamata, Cameron Esposito. Written and directed by J.D Dillard. <em>BH Tilt</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Voice From the Stone</h3><p>A young nurse in 1950s Tuscany believes the wealthy young mute she cares for is possessed by something within the walls of an isolated castle. With Emilia Clarke, Marton Csokas. Written by Andrew Shaw, based on a novel by Silvio Raffo. Directed by Eric D. Howell. <em>Momentum Pictures</em></p><p class=\"date-title\">May 5</p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Bang! The Bert Berns Story</h3><p>Biographical documentary on the songwriter and record producer whose hits included &ldquo;Twist and Shout,&rdquo; &ldquo;Hang on Sloopy,&rdquo; &ldquo;Here Comes the Night&rdquo; and &ldquo;Piece of My Heart.&rdquo; Narrated by Steve Van Zandt. Featuring Ronald Isley, Ben E. King, Solomon Burke, Van Morrison, Keith Richards, Paul McCartney. Directed by Brett Berns and Bob Sarles. <em>Abramorama</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Chuck</h3><p>Liev Schreiber stars as Chuck Wepner, the underdog boxer who inspired &quot;Rocky.&quot; With Naomi Watts, Elisabeth Moss, Ron Perlman, Jim Gaffigan, Michael Rapaport, Pooch Hall, Morgan Spector. Written by Jeff Feuerzeig, Jerry Stahl, Michael Cristofer, Schreiber. Directed by Philippe Falardeau. <em>IFC Films</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The Dinner</h3><p>A gubernatorial candidate, his estranged brother and their wives confront a terrible crime committed by their teenage sons. With Rebecca Hall, Chlo&euml; Sevigny, Richard Gere, Laura Linney, Steve Coogan. Written and directed by Oren Moverman, based on a novel by Herman Koch. <em>The Orchard</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2</h3><p>Filmmaker James Gunn delivers Mixtape #2 as the team explores the mystery of Peter Quill&#39;s heritage and fights galactic baddies. With Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Dave Bautista, Vin Diesel, Bradley Cooper, Michael Rooker, Karen Gillan, Pom Klementieff, Elizabeth Debicki, Chris Sullivan, Sean Gunn, Tommy Flanagan, Laura Haddock, Sylvester Stallone, Kurt Russell. <em><a class=\"taxInlineTagLink\" id=\"ORCRP0017765\" title=\"The Walt Disney Studios\" href=\"/topic/entertainment/the-walt-disney-studios-ORCRP0017765-topic.html\">Walt Disney Pictures</a></em></p><figure class='full left'><div class='responsive-embed raw-brightcove'>92699670</div><figcaption>Star-Lord meets his dad in the &quot;Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2&quot; trailer. The film stars Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Bradley Cooper, Dave Bautista and Karen Gillan.</figcaption></figure><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Julian Schnabel: A Private Portrait</h3><p>The life and work of the painter and filmmaker are chronicled in this documentary. Featuring Mary Boone, Jeff Koons, Vito Schnabel, Willem Dafoe, Bono. Directed by Pappi Corsicato. <em>Cohen Media Group</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The Lovers</h3><p>Debra Winger and Tracy Letts star as a long-married couple whose serious affairs with other people rekindle a spark in their own relationship. With Aidan Gillen, Melora Walters, Tyler Ross, Jessica Sula. Written and directed by Azazel Jacobs. <em>A24</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Obit</h3><p>Documentary on the work of the New York Times obituary writers. Written and directed by Vanessa Gould. <em>Kino Lorber</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Panique</h3><p>A voyeur is framed for murder by a young lady in this restored version of the1946 adaptation of Georges Simenon&rsquo;s &ldquo;Mr. Hire&#39;s Engagement.&rdquo; With Michel Simon, Viviane Romance, Paul Bernard, Max Dalban. Written by Julien Duvivier, Charles Spaak. Directed by Duvivier. <em>Rialto Pictures</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Risk</h3><p>Oscar-winning filmmaker Laura Poitras&rsquo; documentary on Julian Assange. <em>Neon</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Take Me</h3><p>Pat Healy directs and stars in a black comedy about a man who specializes in simulated abductions. With Taylor Schilling. Written by Mike Makowsky. <em>The Orchard</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">3 Generations</h3><p>Elle Fanning, Naomi Watts and Susan Sarandon star as a family living under one roof in New York adjusting to a teen&#39;s decision to transition from female to male. Written by Nikole Beckwith. Directed by Gaby Dellal. <em>Weinstein Company</em></p><p>Also: <strong>Alienate</strong> Horror/Sci-fi. <em>Gravitas Ventures</em> &hellip; <strong>Black Site Delta </strong>Action. <em>XLrator Media </em> &hellip; <strong>Buster&#39;s Mal Heart </strong>Sci-fi thriller. With Rami Malek. <em>Well Go USA</em> &hellip; <strong>Elian</strong> Documentary. <em>Gravitas Ventures</em> &hellip; <strong>Enter the Warriors Gate </strong>Fantasy adventure co-written by Luc Besson. <em>EuropaCorp</em> &hellip; <strong>The Founders </strong>Sports documentary. <em>Level 33</em> &hellip; <strong>Lady Bloodfight</strong> Martial arts action. <em>Vertical Entertainment</em> &hellip; <strong>Mom and Me</strong> Documentary. <em>Uncork&rsquo;d Entertainment</em> &hellip; <strong>Tomorrow Ever After</strong> Sci-fi comedy. <em>Thier Productions</em></p><p class=\"date-title\">May 12</p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Burden</h3><p>Artist Chris Burden, whose work included dangerous stunts, iconic sculptures and installations, and the vintage streetlights outside LACMA, is profiled in this documentary. Directed by Timothy Marrinan &amp; Richard Dewey. <em>Magnolia Pictures</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Harold and Lillian: A Hollywood Love Story</h3><p>Documentary recounts the romantic and creative partnership of storyboard artist Harold Michelson and film researcher Lillian Michelson. Featuring Danny DeVito, Mel Brooks, Francis Ford Coppola. Directed by Daniel Raim. <em>Zeitgeist Films</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">King Arthur: Legend of the Sword</h3><p>A new imagining of the Excalibur myth finds Arthur once more searching for his rightful place in the kingdom. With Charlie Hunnam, Astrid Berg&egrave;s-Frisbey, Djimon Hounsou, Aidan Gillen, Jude Law, Eric Bana. Written by Joby Harold and Guy Ritchie &amp; Lionel Wigram; story by David Dobkin and Joby Harold. Directed by Ritchie. <em>Warner Bros.</em></p><figure class='full left'><div class='responsive-embed raw-brightcove'>92956819</div><figcaption></figcaption></figure><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Like Crazy</h3><p>Two women find deep friendship at an Italian mental hospital and help each other navigate in the real world when they inadvertently gain their freedom. With Valeria Bruni Tedeschi, Micaela Ramazzotti. Written and directed by Paolo Virzi. <em>Strand Releasing</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Lowriders</h3><p>An East L.A. street artist feels caught between the old-school car culture of his father and ex-con brother and his own means of self-expression. With Gabriel Chavarria, Demi&aacute;n Bichir, Eva Longoria, Theo Rossi, Melissa Benoist, Tony Revolori. Written by Cheo Hodari Coker &amp; Elgin James. Directed by Ricardo de Montreuil. <em>Telemundo Films / BH Tilt</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Paris Can Wait</h3><p>A Frenchman restores the love of life for a neglected American wife. With Diane Lane, Arnaud Viard, Alec Baldwin. Written and directed by Eleanor Coppola. <em>Sony Pictures Classics</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Snatched</h3><p>Amy Schumer stars as an impulsive young woman who recruits her rigid mother, played by Goldie Hawn, for a jungle vacation. With Joan Cusack, Ike Barinholtz, Wanda Sykes, Christopher Meloni. Written by Katie Dippold. Directed by Jonathan Levine. <em>20th Century Fox</em></p><figure class='full left'><div class='responsive-embed raw-brightcove'>92143244</div><figcaption>Amy Schumer, Goldie Hawn, Joan Cusack, Ike Barinholtz, Wanda Sykes and Christopher Meloni star in &quot;Snatched.&quot;</figcaption></figure><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The Wall</h3><p>Two U.S. soldiers are trapped with only a crumbling structure between them and an Iraqi sniper. With Aaron Taylor-Johnson, John Cena. Written by Dwain Worrell. Directed by Doug Liman. <em>Amazon Studios / Roadside Attractions</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Whisky Galore!</h3><p>Residents of a Scottish island attempt to liberate 50,000 cases of whisky from a stranded ship in this remake of the 1949 Alexander Mackendrick comedy. With Eddie Izzard, Ellie Kendrick, James Cosmo. Written by Peter McDougall, based on the novel by Compton Mackenzie. Directed by Gillies MacKinnon. <em>Arrow Films</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">A Woman&#39;s Life</h3><p>A young woman&#39;s privileged life in 19th century Normandy is slowly eroded by her husband&#39;s unfaithfulness and pressure from family and community. With Judith Chemla, Jean-Pierre Darroussin, Yolande Moreau, Swann Arlaud. Written by St&eacute;phane Briz&eacute; and Florence Vignon, based on a novel by Guy de Maupassant. Directed by Briz&eacute;. <em>Kino Lorber</em></p><p>Also: <strong>Angkor Awakens </strong>Documentary. Directed by Robert H. Lieberman. <em>Photosynthesis Productions</em> &hellip; <strong>Dead Awake</strong> Horror. <em>FilmRise</em> &hellip; <strong>Folk Hero &amp; Funny Guy </strong>Comedy with Alex Karpovsky. <em>Gravitas Ventures</em> &hellip; <strong>Get Me Roger Stone </strong>Documentary. <em>Netflix</em> &hellip; <strong>Hounds of Love </strong>Horror. <em>Gunpowder &amp; Sky</em> &hellip; <strong>Long Live the King </strong>Documentary. <em>Indie Rights</em> &hellip; <strong>Sacred </strong>Documentary directed by Thomas Lennon. <em>Argot Pictures</em> &hellip; <strong>Tracktown</strong> Drama with Alexi Pappas. <em>Samuel Goldwyn Films</em> &hellip; <strong>Urban Hymn </strong>Crime drama. <em>Level 33</em> &hellip; <strong>Violet</strong> Drama. <em>Ryan Bruce Levey Film Distribution</em></p><p class=\"date-title\">May 19</p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Alien: Covenant</h3><p>The crew of a colony ship makes a terrifying discovery after landing on what seems to be an uncharted paradise on the far side of the galaxy. With Michael Fassbender, Katherine Waterston, Billy Crudup, Danny McBride, Demi&aacute;n Bichir. Written by John Logan. Directed by Ridley Scott. <em>20th Century Fox</em></p><figure class='full left'><div class='responsive-embed raw-brightcove'>92690423</div><figcaption>Katherine Waterston, Danny McBride and Michael Fassbender star in the trailer for Ridley Scott&#x27;s &quot;Alien Covenant.&quot;</figcaption></figure><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The Commune</h3><p>An affair threatens the idealistic cooperative an upscale Copenhagen couple establish in their home. With Ulrich Thomsen, Trine Dyrholm, Fares Fares. Written by Tobias Lindholm, Thomas Vinterberg. Directed by Vinterberg. <em>Magnolia Pictures</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Diary of a Wimpy Kid: The Long Haul</h3><p>The family takes a road trip and Greg schemes to become famous as a new cast takes over for the fourth installment based on Jeff Kinney&#39;s comic youth novels. With Jason Ian Drucker, Charlie Wright, Owen Asztalos, Tom Everett Scott, Alicia Silverstone. Written by Kinney and director David Bowers. <em>20th Century Fox</em></p><figure class='full left'><div class='responsive-embed raw-brightcove'>92641828</div><figcaption></figcaption></figure><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Everything, Everything</h3><p>An 18-year-old woman, confined to her house in a protected environment because of an illness, forms an attachment to the boy next door and yearns to experience the outside world. With Amandla Stenberg, Nick Robinson, Ana De La Reguera, Anika Noni Rose. Written by J. Mills Goodloe, based on the book by Nicola Yoon. Directed by Stella Meghie. <em>Warner Bros./ MGM</em></p><figure class='full left'><div class='responsive-embed raw-brightcove'>92595368</div><figcaption></figcaption></figure><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Hell on Earth: The Fall of Syria and the Rise of Isis</h3><p>Directors Sebastian Junger and Nick Quested map the region&rsquo;s turmoil in this documentary. <em>National Geographic</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Last Men in Aleppo</h3><p>Verit&eacute; documentary follows three &ldquo;White Helmets&rdquo; &mdash; volunteer first responders who rush in to some of the most dangerous areas in Syria. Directed by Feras Fayyad, Steen Johannessen. <em>Grasshopper Film</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Paint It Black</h3><p>The suicide of a young artist brings together his girlfriend and mother as they confront their grief. (1:50) NR. <em>Roadside Attractions</em></p><p>Also: <strong>Devil&#39;s Domain</strong> Horror film with Michael Madsen. <em>Cleopatra Entertainment</em> &hellip; <strong>Fight for Space</strong> Documentary. <em>Gravitas Ventures</em> &hellip; <strong>If You&#39;re Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast</strong> Documentary. Written by Andrzej Mularczyk. <em>Film Movement</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Baywatch</h3><p>Dwayne Johnson steps into the formidable flip flops of David Hasselhoff as lifeguard Mitch Buchanan in this adaptation of the 1990s TV series. Directed by Michael Showalter. <em>Amazon Studios / Lionsgate</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Hare Krishna</h3><p>Documentary on Srila Prabhupada, the 70-year-old Indian swami who launched a cultural and spiritual phenomenon when he arrived in the U.S. penniless in the 1960s. With Josh Duhamel, Laura Haddock, Jerrod Carmichael, Isabela Moner, Santiago Cabrera. Written by Art Marcum &amp; Matt Holloway &amp; Ken Nolan, story by Akiva Goldsman. Directed by Bainbridge, co-directed by Maiorana. <em>Kino Lorber</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The Unknown Girl</h3><p>A young doctor attempts to discover the identity of a dead girl so that she is not buried anonymously. With Adele Haenel, Jeremie Renier, Olivier Bonnaud, Louka Minnella. Written and directed by Jean-Pierre Dardenne, Luc Dardenne. <em>Sundance Selects</em></p><p>Also: <strong>Gook</strong> Drama. <em>Samuel Goldwyn Films</em> &hellip; <strong>Heartstone</strong> Icelandic drama. <em>Breaking Glass Pictures</em> &hellip; <strong>Jes&uacute;s</strong> Chilean drama. <em>Breaking Glass Pictures</em> &hellip; <strong>Wild</strong> Drama. <em>DADA Films / Required Viewing</em></p><p class=\"date-title\">Sept. 1</p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Unlocked</h3><p>A CIA agent teams with an ex-soldier to stop a deadly biological attack on London. With Noomi Rapace, Orlando Bloom, Toni Collette, John Malkovich, Michael Douglas. Written by Peter O&rsquo;Brien. Director Michael Apted. <em>Lionsgate Premiere</em></p><p>Also: <strong>Fallen</strong> Drama directed by Scott Hicks. <em>Sony Pictures Worldwide / Vertical Entertainment &hellip; </em><strong>The Layover </strong>Comedy with Alexandra Daddario, Kal Penn, Rob Corddry, Molly Shannon. Directed by William H. Macy. <em>Vertical Entertainment</em></p><p class=\"date-title\">Summer TBD</p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">The Last Face</h3><p>In wartime Liberia, a relief aid doctor and the director of an international organization have an affair as they battle over the best way to help those around them. With Charlize Theron, Javier Bardem, Ad&egrave;le Exarchopoulos, Jared Harris, Jean Reno, Denise Newman. Written by Erin Dignam. Directed by Sean Penn. <em>Saban Films / Lionsgate</em></p><h3 class=\"benton-title timeline-title\">Trophy</h3><p>The effects of big-game hunting, breeding and wildlife conservation on endangered African animals are investigated in this documentary. Directed by Shaul Schwarz. <em>The Orchard</em></p><p>-------------</p><h3>For the Record</h3><p>April 21, 1:37 p.m.</p><p>An earlier version of this story stated a film&rsquo;s title as &ldquo;Wished Upon&rdquo;; it is &ldquo;Wish Upon.&rdquo; The film listed as &ldquo;Last Man in Aleppo&rdquo; is titled &ldquo;Last Men in Aleppo.&rdquo; The list says &ldquo;The Beguiled&rdquo; is scheduled to open June 30; it is scheduled to open June 23 in selected cities. The list says &ldquo;Detroit&rdquo; is scheduled to open Aug. 11; it is scheduled to open Aug. 4. The name of an actress in &ldquo;The Black Rose&rdquo; is given as Kristana Loken; her first name is spelled Kristanna. A film distributor is listed as XLrator Entertainment; it is XLrator Media.</p><p class=\"roadblock\"><strong><a href=\"http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/popular/\">See the most-read stories in Entertainment this hour &raquo;</a></strong></p><p><strong><a href=\"mailto:calendar@latimes.com\" target=\"_blank\">calendar@latimes.com</a></strong></p><p><strong><a href=\"https://twitter.com/latimesmovies\" target=\"_blank\">@LATimesMovies</a></strong></p><p><strong><strong>ALSO:</strong></strong></p><p><strong><a href=\"http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesneaks/la-ca-mn-sneaks-beguiled-sofia-coppola-20170421-story.html\" target=\"_blank\"><strong>Sofia Coppola makes &#39;The Beguiled&#39; a Southern Gothic tale all her own</strong></a></strong></p><p><strong><a href=\"http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesneaks/la-ca-mn-sneaks-dunkirk-fionn-whitehead-20170421-story.html\"      [data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_embed_thumb,[data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_embed_thumb+.trb_embed_related{display:none!important}\n                .trb_article_mediaWrapper .trb_embed_related_credit{display:inline-block}.trb_article_mediaWrapper .trb_article .trb_embed[data-content-size=leadart][data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_embed .trb_embed_media .trb_embed_related_credit_and_caption{display:none}[data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_embed_media .trb_embed_related .trb_embed_related_title{display:block;margin:0;padding:0;float:none;width:auto;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;-moz-osx-font-smoothing:grayscale}[data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_embed_media .trb_embed_related .trb_embed_related_title{color:#FFF;font-size:20px;font-family:LAHeadline,'Times New Roman',serif;font-weight:700;letter-spacing:1px;margin-bottom:15px}[data-content-branded] [data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_embed_media .trb_embed_related .trb_embed_related_title{font-family:Arial,sans-serif}@media screen and (min-width:700px)and (max-width:899px){[data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_embed_media .trb_embed_related .trb_embed_related[data-c-pl]:before{width:50px;height:50px;line-height:50px;font-size:13px;margin-left:0}[data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_embed_media .trb_embed_related[data-c-pl] .trb_embed_media_next:before,[data-state~=lightbox_lightboxOpen] .trb_backplate [data-role~=carousel_view] .trb_embed_media_prev:before{padding:12px 0}</script>\n<script type=\"trb/css\" data-css-key=videoscroll>\n</script>\n</body>\n</html>", "title": "Every single movie coming out this summer", "url": "http://www.latimes.com/la-ca-mn-summer-sneaks-list-20170421-htmlstory.html", "date": "04-21-2017", "source": "latimes", "text": "The 2017 Summer Movie Preview is a snapshot of the films opening through early September. Release dates and other details are subject to change.\n\nBelow Her Mouth\n\nA fashion editor finds herself drawn into a steamy affair with another woman. With Natalie Krill, Sebastian Pigott, Erika Linder. Written by Stephanie Fabrizi. Directed by April Mullen. Gunpowder & Sky\n\nThe Black Room\n\nA couple discover an evil, lustful presence inhabiting the basement of their new home. With Natasha Henstridge, Luke Hassel, Lin Shaye, Dominique Swain. Written and directed by Rolfe Kanefsky. Cleopatra Entertainment\n\nBlack Rose\n\nThe LAPD recruits a Russian police officer to help hunt a serial killer. With Alexander Nevsky, Kristanna Loken, Adrian Paul, Robert Davi, Matthias Hues. Written by Brent Huff, George Saunders. Directed by Nevsky. ITN Distribution\n\nCasting JonBen\u00e9t\n\nMeta-documentary by Kitty Green on the 1996 killing of 6-year-old JonBen\u00e9t Ramsey. Netflix\n\nSEE OUR COMPLETE SUMMER MOVIE PREVIEW \u00bb\n\nThe Circle\n\nA young woman experiences success at the world's largest technology and social media company and is encouraged to live her life completely in the open. With Emma Watson, Tom Hanks, John Boyega, Patton Oswalt, Bill Paxton, Karen Gillan, Ellar Coltrane. Written and directed by James Ponsoldt, based on the novel by Dave Eggers. STX Entertainment\n\n92137734 Emma Watson and Tom Hanks star in \"The Circle.\"\n\nCitizen Jane: Battle for the City\n\nDocumentary explores the mid-20th-century battles between urbanization critic and activist Jane Jacobs and New York master builder Robert Moses. Directed by Matt Tyrnauer. Sundance Selects\n\nDanger Close\n\nFemale war correspondent Alex Quade chronicles the stories of U.S. Special Operations Forces in the third film in the \"Heroes of Valor\" docu-action series. Featuring Wendy R. Anderson. Written by Eli Baldridge and Quade. Directed by Christian Tureaud and David Salzberg. Gravitas Ventures\n\nA Dark Song\n\nIn a cabin in northern Wales, two lost souls experiment with black magic. With Steve Oram, Catherine Walker. Written and directed by Liam Gavin. IFC Midnight\n\nDisplacement\n\nA physics student time travels as she attempts to solve her boyfriend's murder. With Courtney Hope, Bruce Davison, Susan Blakely, Sarah Douglas, Lou Richards, Karan Oberoi, Christopher Backus. Written and directed by Kenneth Mader. Arcadia Releasing Group\n\nGrey Lady\n\nA Boston homicide detective hunts his partner's killer on Nantucket Island. With Eric Dane, Natalie Zea, Adrian Lester, Carolyn Stotesbery, Chris Meyer, Rebecca Gayheart. Written and directed by John Shea. Beacon Pictures / Broadvision Entertainment\n\nHow to Be a Latin Lover\n\nEugenio Derbez stars as a struggling middle-aged gigolo forced to move in with his sister and nephew. With Salma Hayek, Rob Lowe, Kristen Bell, Raquel Welch, Rob Corddry, Rob Riggle, Michael Cera, Raphael Alejandro. Written by Chris Spain, Jon Zack. Directed by Ken Marino. Pantelion\n\n92595644 Eugenio Derbez, Salma Hayek and Rob Lowe star in \"How to Be a Latin Lover.\"\n\nThe King's Case Note\n\nDuring Korea\u2019s Joseon Dynasty, King Yejong and his assistant investigate rumors that there will be an attempt on the throne. With Lee Sun-kyun, Ahn Jae-hong. Written by Kang Hyun-sung. Directed by Moon Hyung-sung. CJ Entertainment\n\nLA92\n\nThe Los Angeles uprising after the Rodney King verdict is explored through archival footage in this documentary marking the 25th anniversary. Directed by Daniel Lindsay, T.J. Martin. National Geographic\n\nOne Week and a Day\n\nAt the end of the traditional Jewish mourning period after the death of his son, a middle-aged Israeli man chooses to see what makes life meaningful rather than return to his regular routine. With Shai Avivi, Evgenia Dodina, Tomer Kapon. Written and directed by Asaph Polonsky. Oscilloscope Laboratories\n\nRupture\n\nA single mom is abducted and learns she has a genetic abnormality that could cause her true alien nature to be revealed. With Noomi Rapace, Michael Chiklis, Peter Stormare, Kerry Bishe. Written by Steven Shainberg and Brian Nelson. Directed by Shainberg. AMBI Media Group\n\nSlack Bay\n\nAn eccentric family spend its summer in a coastal villa in early 20th century France. With Juliette Binoche, Fabrice Luchini, Valeria Bruni Tedeschi. Written and directed by Bruno Dumont. Kino Lorber\n\nSleight\n\nA young street magician must use his mystical ways to rescue his kidnapped sister. With Jacob Latimore, Storm Reid, Seychelle Gabriel, Dul\u00e9 Hill, Sasheer Zamata, Cameron Esposito. Written and directed by J.D Dillard. BH Tilt\n\nVoice From the Stone\n\nA young nurse in 1950s Tuscany believes the wealthy young mute she cares for is possessed by something within the walls of an isolated castle. With Emilia Clarke, Marton Csokas. Written by Andrew Shaw, based on a novel by Silvio Raffo. Directed by Eric D. Howell. Momentum Pictures\n\nBang! The Bert Berns Story\n\nBiographical documentary on the songwriter and record producer whose hits included \u201cTwist and Shout,\u201d \u201cHang on Sloopy,\u201d \u201cHere Comes the Night\u201d and \u201cPiece of My Heart.\u201d Narrated by Steve Van Zandt. Featuring Ronald Isley, Ben E. King, Solomon Burke, Van Morrison, Keith Richards, Paul McCartney. Directed by Brett Berns and Bob Sarles. Abramorama\n\nChuck\n\nLiev Schreiber stars as Chuck Wepner, the underdog boxer who inspired \"Rocky.\" With Naomi Watts, Elisabeth Moss, Ron Perlman, Jim Gaffigan, Michael Rapaport, Pooch Hall, Morgan Spector. Written by Jeff Feuerzeig, Jerry Stahl, Michael Cristofer, Schreiber. Directed by Philippe Falardeau. IFC Films\n\nThe Dinner\n\nA gubernatorial candidate, his estranged brother and their wives confront a terrible crime committed by their teenage sons. With Rebecca Hall, Chlo\u00eb Sevigny, Richard Gere, Laura Linney, Steve Coogan. Written and directed by Oren Moverman, based on a novel by Herman Koch. The Orchard\n\nGuardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2\n\nFilmmaker James Gunn delivers Mixtape #2 as the team explores the mystery of Peter Quill's heritage and fights galactic baddies. With Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Dave Bautista, Vin Diesel, Bradley Cooper, Michael Rooker, Karen Gillan, Pom Klementieff, Elizabeth Debicki, Chris Sullivan, Sean Gunn, Tommy Flanagan, Laura Haddock, Sylvester Stallone, Kurt Russell. Walt Disney Pictures\n\n92699670 Star-Lord meets his dad in the \"Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2\" trailer. The film stars Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Bradley Cooper, Dave Bautista and Karen Gillan.\n\nJulian Schnabel: A Private Portrait\n\nThe life and work of the painter and filmmaker are chronicled in this documentary. Featuring Mary Boone, Jeff Koons, Vito Schnabel, Willem Dafoe, Bono. Directed by Pappi Corsicato. Cohen Media Group\n\nThe Lovers\n\nDebra Winger and Tracy Letts star as a long-married couple whose serious affairs with other people rekindle a spark in their own relationship. With Aidan Gillen, Melora Walters, Tyler Ross, Jessica Sula. Written and directed by Azazel Jacobs. A24\n\nObit\n\nDocumentary on the work of the New York Times obituary writers. Written and directed by Vanessa Gould. Kino Lorber\n\nPanique\n\nA voyeur is framed for murder by a young lady in this restored version of the1946 adaptation of Georges Simenon\u2019s \u201cMr. Hire's Engagement.\u201d With Michel Simon, Viviane Romance, Paul Bernard, Max Dalban. Written by Julien Duvivier, Charles Spaak. Directed by Duvivier. Rialto Pictures\n\nRisk\n\nOscar-winning filmmaker Laura Poitras\u2019 documentary on Julian Assange. Neon\n\nTake Me\n\nPat Healy directs and stars in a black comedy about a man who specializes in simulated abductions. With Taylor Schilling. Written by Mike Makowsky. The Orchard\n\n3 Generations\n\nElle Fanning, Naomi Watts and Susan Sarandon star as a family living under one roof in New York adjusting to a teen's decision to transition from female to male. Written by Nikole Beckwith. Directed by Gaby Dellal. Weinstein Company\n\nAlso: Alienate Horror/Sci-fi. Gravitas Ventures \u2026 Black Site Delta Action. XLrator Media \u2026 Buster's Mal Heart Sci-fi thriller. With Rami Malek. Well Go USA \u2026 Elian Documentary. Gravitas Ventures \u2026 Enter the Warriors Gate Fantasy adventure co-written by Luc Besson. EuropaCorp \u2026 The Founders Sports documentary. Level 33 \u2026 Lady Bloodfight Martial arts action. Vertical Entertainment \u2026 Mom and Me Documentary. Uncork\u2019d Entertainment \u2026 Tomorrow Ever After Sci-fi comedy. Thier Productions\n\nBurden\n\nArtist Chris Burden, whose work included dangerous stunts, iconic sculptures and installations, and the vintage streetlights outside LACMA, is profiled in this documentary. Directed by Timothy Marrinan & Richard Dewey. Magnolia Pictures\n\nHarold and Lillian: A Hollywood Love Story\n\nDocumentary recounts the romantic and creative partnership of storyboard artist Harold Michelson and film researcher Lillian Michelson. Featuring Danny DeVito, Mel Brooks, Francis Ford Coppola. Directed by Daniel Raim. Zeitgeist Films\n\nKing Arthur: Legend of the Sword\n\nA new imagining of the Excalibur myth finds Arthur once more searching for his rightful place in the kingdom. With Charlie Hunnam, Astrid Berg\u00e8s-Frisbey, Djimon Hounsou, Aidan Gillen, Jude Law, Eric Bana. Written by Joby Harold and Guy Ritchie & Lionel Wigram; story by David Dobkin and Joby Harold. Directed by Ritchie. Warner Bros.\n\n92956819\n\nLike Crazy\n\nTwo women find deep friendship at an Italian mental hospital and help each other navigate in the real world when they inadvertently gain their freedom. With Valeria Bruni Tedeschi, Micaela Ramazzotti. Written and directed by Paolo Virzi. Strand Releasing\n\nLowriders\n\nAn East L.A. street artist feels caught between the old-school car culture of his father and ex-con brother and his own means of self-expression. With Gabriel Chavarria, Demi\u00e1n Bichir, Eva Longoria, Theo Rossi, Melissa Benoist, Tony Revolori. Written by Cheo Hodari Coker & Elgin James. Directed by Ricardo de Montreuil. Telemundo Films / BH Tilt\n\nParis Can Wait\n\nA Frenchman restores the love of life for a neglected American wife. With Diane Lane, Arnaud Viard, Alec Baldwin. Written and directed by Eleanor Coppola. Sony Pictures Classics\n\nSnatched\n\nAmy Schumer stars as an impulsive young woman who recruits her rigid mother, played by Goldie Hawn, for a jungle vacation. With Joan Cusack, Ike Barinholtz, Wanda Sykes, Christopher Meloni. Written by Katie Dippold. Directed by Jonathan Levine. 20th Century Fox\n\n92143244 Amy Schumer, Goldie Hawn, Joan Cusack, Ike Barinholtz, Wanda Sykes and Christopher Meloni star in \"Snatched.\"\n\nThe Wall\n\nTwo U.S. soldiers are trapped with only a crumbling structure between them and an Iraqi sniper. With Aaron Taylor-Johnson, John Cena. Written by Dwain Worrell. Directed by Doug Liman. Amazon Studios / Roadside Attractions\n\nWhisky Galore!\n\nResidents of a Scottish island attempt to liberate 50,000 cases of whisky from a stranded ship in this remake of the 1949 Alexander Mackendrick comedy. With Eddie Izzard, Ellie Kendrick, James Cosmo. Written by Peter McDougall, based on the novel by Compton Mackenzie. Directed by Gillies MacKinnon. Arrow Films\n\nA Woman's Life\n\nA young woman's privileged life in 19th century Normandy is slowly eroded by her husband's unfaithfulness and pressure from family and community. With Judith Chemla, Jean-Pierre Darroussin, Yolande Moreau, Swann Arlaud. Written by St\u00e9phane Briz\u00e9 and Florence Vignon, based on a novel by Guy de Maupassant. Directed by Briz\u00e9. Kino Lorber\n\nAlso: Angkor Awakens Documentary. Directed by Robert H. Lieberman. Photosynthesis Productions \u2026 Dead Awake Horror. FilmRise \u2026 Folk Hero & Funny Guy Comedy with Alex Karpovsky. Gravitas Ventures \u2026 Get Me Roger Stone Documentary. Netflix \u2026 Hounds of Love Horror. Gunpowder & Sky \u2026 Long Live the King Documentary. Indie Rights \u2026 Sacred Documentary directed by Thomas Lennon. Argot Pictures \u2026 Tracktown Drama with Alexi Pappas. Samuel Goldwyn Films \u2026 Urban Hymn Crime drama. Level 33 \u2026 Violet Drama. Ryan Bruce Levey Film Distribution\n\nAlien: Covenant\n\nThe crew of a colony ship makes a terrifying discovery after landing on what seems to be an uncharted paradise on the far side of the galaxy. With Michael Fassbender, Katherine Waterston, Billy Crudup, Danny McBride, Demi\u00e1n Bichir. Written by John Logan. Directed by Ridley Scott. 20th Century Fox\n\n92690423 Katherine Waterston, Danny McBride and Michael Fassbender star in the trailer for Ridley Scott's \"Alien Covenant.\"\n\nThe Commune\n\nAn affair threatens the idealistic cooperative an upscale Copenhagen couple establish in their home. With Ulrich Thomsen, Trine Dyrholm, Fares Fares. Written by Tobias Lindholm, Thomas Vinterberg. Directed by Vinterberg. Magnolia Pictures\n\nDiary of a Wimpy Kid: The Long Haul\n\nThe family takes a road trip and Greg schemes to become famous as a new cast takes over for the fourth installment based on Jeff Kinney's comic youth novels. With Jason Ian Drucker, Charlie Wright, Owen Asztalos, Tom Everett Scott, Alicia Silverstone. Written by Kinney and director David Bowers. 20th Century Fox\n\n92641828\n\nEverything, Everything\n\nAn 18-year-old woman, confined to her house in a protected environment because of an illness, forms an attachment to the boy next door and yearns to experience the outside world. With Amandla Stenberg, Nick Robinson, Ana De La Reguera, Anika Noni Rose. Written by J. Mills Goodloe, based on the book by Nicola Yoon. Directed by Stella Meghie. Warner Bros./ MGM\n\n92595368\n\nHell on Earth: The Fall of Syria and the Rise of Isis\n\nDirectors Sebastian Junger and Nick Quested map the region\u2019s turmoil in this documentary. With Anastasia Shevtsova, Niels Schneider, Juliette Binoche, J\u00e9r\u00e9mie B\u00e9lingard, Aleksei Guskov. Oscilloscope Laboratories\n\nValerian and the City of a Thousand Planets\n\nBased on the graphic novel series in which government operatives travel to a rapidly expanding intergalactic metropolis called Alpha, a Utopian convergence of talents where dark forces are at work. With Dane DeHaan, Cara Delevingne, Clive Owen, Rihanna, Ethan Hawke, John Goodman, Herbie Hancock, Kris Wu. Written and directed by Luc Besson. STX Entertainment\n\n92921549 Watch the trailer for \"Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets.\"\n\nAlso: False Confessions French drama with Isabelle Huppert. Big World Pictures \u2026 First Kill Thriller with Hayden Christensen, Bruce Willis. Lionsgate Premiere \u2026 Who the \u2026 Is That Guy? Music documentary. XLrator Media\n\nAtomic Blonde\n\nCharlize Theron stars as an MI6 agent ordered to Berlin to break up a savage spy ring. With James McAvoy, John Goodman, Sofia Boutella, Til Schweiger, James Faulkner, Eddie Marsan, Roland M\u00f8ller, Bill Skarsg\u00e5rd, Barbara Sukowa, Johannes Johannesson, Toby Jones. Written by Kurt Johnstad, based on the graphic novel by Antony Johnston and illustrator Sam Hart. Directed by David Leitch. Focus Features\n\nBrigsby Bear\n\nA young man raised in an underground bunker watching an ursine children's program learns his world is about to expand exponentially. With Kyle Mooney, Mark Hamill, Claire Danes, Greg Kinnear, Andy Samberg. Written by Kevin Costello, Mooney. Directed by Dave McCary. Sony Pictures Classics\n\nThe Emoji Movie\n\nThe tiny expressions living inside your smartphone come alive in this animated adventure. Voices by T.J. Miller, James Corden, Anna Faris. Written by Tony Leondis & Eric Siegel and Mike White. Directed by Leondis. Columbia Pictures\n\nFrom the Land of the Moon\n\nMarion Cotillard stars a woman in post-World War II France trapped in an arranged marriage but dreaming of true love. With Louis Garrel, \u00c0lex Brendem\u00fchl. Written by Nicole Garcia and Jacques Fieschi. Directed by Garcia. Sundance Selects\n\nAn Inconvenient Sequel: Truth to Power\n\nFormer Vice President Al Gore continues his fight for renewable energy in this follow-up to the 2006 Oscar-winning climate change documentary. Directed by Bonni Cohen and Jon Shenk. Paramount Pictures\n\n92920081 Al Gore returns in the sequel to the 2006 documentary \"An Inconvenient Truth.\"\n\nThe Leisure Seeker\n\nAn aging couple escape the smothering effects of doctors and children with a road trip from Boston to Key West. With Donald Sutherland, Helen Mirren, Kirsty Mitchell. Written by Stephen Amidon, Francesca Archibugi, Paolo Virz\u00ec and Francesco Piccolo, based on the novel by Michael Zadoorian. Directed by Paolo Virzi. Sony Pictures Classics\n\nMenashe\n\nA Hasidic Jew in Borough Park, Brooklyn, must prove to the community he is capable of raising his son after the death of his wife. With Menashe Lustig, Ruben Nyborg. Written by Joshua Z. Weinstein, Alex Lipschultz and Musa Syeed. Directed by Weinstein. A24\n\nAlso: A Family Man Drama with Gerard Butler, Gretchen Mol, Alison Brie. Vertical Entertainment \u2026 Imperfections Crime comedy. Brainstorm Media\n\nDesert Hearts\n\nA stuffy East Coast lit professor in 1957 Reno for a divorce falls for a young lesbian sculptor in this re-release of director Donna Deitch's groundbreaking 1985 film. Written by Natalie Cooper, based on the novel by Jane Rule. Janus Films\n\nColumbus\n\nWhile staying in a small Indiana town, the son of a renowned architecture scholar develops a deep relationship with a young woman. With John Cho, Haley Lu Richardson, Michelle Forbes, Rory Culkin, Parker Posey. Written and directed by Kogonada. Superlative Films/Depth of Field\n\nThe Dark Tower\n\nBased on Stephen King's series of novels about a young boy and a frontiersman knight on an interdimensional quest. With Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey, Tom Taylor, Claudia Kim, Fran Kranz, Abbey Lee, Jackie Earle Haley. Written by Akiva Goldsman & Jeff Pinkner and Anders Thomas Jensen & Nikolaj Arcel. Directed by Arcel. Columbia Pictures\n\nDetroit\n\nThis crime drama exploring systemic racism is set during five days of unrest and violence in the Michigan city during summer 1967. With John Boyega, John Krasinski, Jason Mitchell, Anthony Mackie, Will Poulter, Ben O\u2019Toole, Jack Reynor, Jacob Latimore, Joseph David-Jones, Algee Smith, Kaitlyn Dever, Hannah Murray. Written by Mark Boal. Directed by Kathryn Bigelow. Annapurna Pictures\n\n93037253 \"Detroit,\" from the director of \"The Hurt Locker\" and \"Zero Dark Thirty,\" stars John Boyega and is based on the civil unrest that rocked Detroit in the summer of 1967.\n\nIngrid Goes West\n\nAfter the death of her mother, a young woman moves to L.A. and befriends an Instagram star. With Aubrey Plaza, Elizabeth Olsen, O\u2019Shea Jackson Jr, Wyatt Russell. Written by Matt Spicer and David Branson Smith. Directed by Spicer. Neon\n\nStep\n\nDocumentary follows the senior year of a Baltimore step dance team. Featuring Blessin Giraldo, Cori Grainger, Tayla Solomon, Gari McIntyre, Paula Dofat. Directed by Amanda Lipitz. Fox Searchlight\n\n93044729 \"Step\" is a documentary about a girls' high school step dance team in Baltimore.\n\nWind River\n\nAn experienced FBI agent teams with a local tracker to solve a young girl's murder on a Native American reservation. With Jeremy Renner, Elizabeth Olsen, Jon Bernthal. Written and directed by Taylor Sheridan. Weinstein Company\n\nAlso: Brave New Jersey Comedy with Anna Camp, Sam Jaeger, Heather Burns. Directed by Sabaah Folayan and Damon Davis. Magnolia Pictures\n\nAlso: Pilgrimage Action film with Tom Holland. RLJ Entertainment \u2026 Realive Sci-fi with Tom Hughes, Charlotte le Bon. With Nakhane Tour\u00e9, Bongile Mantsai, Niza Jay. Written and directed by John Trengove. With Nat Wolff, Margaret Qualley, Keith Stanfield. Written by Jeremy Slater, based on the Japanese manga written by Tsugumi Ohba and Takeshi Obata. Directed by Adam Wingard. With Kathryn Prescott, Mitch Pileggi, Grace Zabriskie, Tyler Young, Keenan Tracey, Samantha Logan, Priscilla Quintana, Madelaine Petsch, Javier Botet. Written by Blair Butler. Directed by Lars Klevberg. Dimension Films\n\nTulip Fever\n\nA married woman in 17th century Amsterdam and her lover stake their hopes of running away together on the city's tulip bulb market. The Orchard\n\n-------------\n\nFor the Record\n\nApril 21, 1:37 p.m.\n\nAn earlier version of this story stated a film\u2019s title as \u201cWished Upon\u201d; it is \u201cWish Upon.\u201d The film listed as \u201cLast Man in Aleppo\u201d is titled \u201cLast Men in Aleppo.\u201d The list says \u201cThe Beguiled\u201d is scheduled to open June 30; it is scheduled to open June 23 in selected cities. The list says \u201cDetroit\u201d is scheduled to open Aug. 11; it is scheduled to open Aug. 4. The name of an actress in \u201cThe Black Rose\u201d is given as Kristana Loken; her first name is spelled Kristanna. A film distributor is listed as XLrator Entertainment; it is XLrator Media.\n\nSee the most-read stories in Entertainment this hour \u00bb\n\ncalendar@latimes.com\n\n@LATimesMovies\n\nALSO:\n\nSofia Coppola makes 'The Beguiled' a Southern Gothic tale all her own\n\n'Dunkirk' star Fionn Whitehead takes on war, Christopher Nolan and One Direction\n\n'Paris Can Wait,' 'Ingrid Goes West,' 'The Hero' offer grown-up alternatives to typical summer blockbusters", "images": ["http://www.trbimg.com/img-58f87e69/turbine/la-1492680293-997e8q1199-snap-image", "http://www.trbimg.com/img-58fac71d/turbine/la-ca-mn-summer-sneaks-list-20170421"], "videos": []}
